cab.content: (This Document is the Property of His Britannic lV1ajesty's Government.)RET,1L Daily Jenns. 11uBATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - AUGUST 5th, 1918.WESTERN FRONT.French Front. The enemy Is stubbornly resisting the attempts of the French to cross the RXVER VE3LE, tut the French have succeeded in slightly enlarging their bridge-head at LA GRANGE FARM, (north west of BRAINE), and have advanced to the east of this neighbourhood, 600 yards on the north bank- Otherwise there is no change on this section of the front * It is reported that the bridge over the AISME at CON BE has been destroyed by the enemy.Between MONTDIDISR and CASTEL there is no change except that the French have succeeded in throwing 2 bridges across the AVRE at BRACHES.M British Front. The enemy has evacuated his front line for about 800 yards Immediately north of the LA BASSEE CAHAL, and posts have been established by us in this part. Othsr-v.dse there is no change in the general situation.ITALIAH AND MACEDONIA^ FRONTS. There is nothing to report.General Staff, War Office, S.W.I. 5th iaigust 1918.Issued at 6.40 p.m.
